This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record:
the structure and classification of products, activities, documents, organizations and people;
The structure of products includes both composition and connection relationships. A composition relationship can be either physical or functional. Similarly a functional relationship can be either physical or functional. Types or classes of relationship are defined in a Reference Data Library. The type of a relationship indicates whether it is functional or physical.
'Bolted connection' is a class of connection that is physical. The connection between pipe segment 'S12' and the inlet nozzle of vessel 'V4506' is a connection of this class.
'Signal connection' is a class of connection that is functional. The connection between instrument signal line 'i1' and the flow instrument '45-FT-501' is a connection of this class.
the properties of products and activities;
the library identification of classes of product and activity.
individual products, activities, documents, organizations and people, and their structure and classification with respect to libraries of classes of product, activity, document, organization and person; This is within the scope of the Structure_and_classification application module.
properties of products and activities; This is within the scope of the Property_and_property_assignment application module.
shape and position of products;
schematic representation of product, activities, documents, organization or employment structure. This is within the scope of the Functional_data_and_schematic_representation application module.
